intro: [WRONG START] Acetosella vulgarish subsp. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pyrenees region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, bright green leaves that are often heart-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the genus Acetosella.
